text: Martin Joseph Hoffman (15 November 1929 â€“ 15 May 2018) was a Czech-born British professional bridge player and writer of Jewish descent. He was born in Prague. He was a survivor of the Holocaust and transported to Auschwitz. He was later moved to the Monowitz-Buna, Gross Rosen and Birkenau sub-camps of Auschwitz; and from there he was sent on a death march towards Buchenwald. In 1945, he was liberated by American Army troops, who adopted him as mascot, with the honorary rank of sergeant. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Sportspeople from London Category:Contract bridge players Category:Czech Jews Category:Holocaust survivors Category:Jewish sportspeople Category:Naturalised citizens of the United Kingdom Category:Sportspeople from Prague
